New Records: Pablo López reached the first 200-strikeout season of his career
López became the ninth Twins pitcher to reach the 200-strikeout threshold, and the first since José Berríos in 2018
López joined Johan Santana as the only pitchers in Twins history to make a scoreless start with at least 14 strikeouts and no walks
Key Match Events: López dazzled for eight scoreless innings against the Mets while fanning a career-high 14 batters
Pre-Game Insights: López told manager Rocco Baldelli after his last start, “I’m better than that.”
Post-Match Reflections: López said, “Any time my name is next to Santana in any way, any category, anything, it means a lot to me.”
López became the first Twins pitcher since Santana to accomplish certain feats
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins had already secured their third consecutive series victory to begin September
The Twins hold a 7 1/2-game lead on the Guardians for the AL Central title
López’s outing pushed him to a career-high 213 strikeouts for the season, the most by any Twins pitcher since Santana fanned 235 in ‘07
